text: Robert Slater was an English international lawn bowls player who competed in the 1934 British Empire Games. ==Bowls career== At the 1934 British Empire Games he won the gold medal in the rinks/fours event with Ernie Gudgeon, Percy Tomlinson and Fred Biggin. He was the 1933 and 1934 pairs champion with Billy Buckell at the National Championships representing Callenders Bowling Club, Kent and was also twice Kent County champion. ==References== Category:English male bowls players Category:Bowls players at the 1934 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games gold medallists for England Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in lawn bowls
title: Robert Slater (bowls)
